intro: Tetrapterys boliviensis, commonly known as the Bolivian spurge, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Euphorbiaceae family, which includes many species with milky sap. The plant is characterized by its alternate, ovate leaves with prominent veins and small, clustered flowers. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories. Due to its ornamental value and medicinal potential, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens.
